THE FIVE-YEAR HISTORY

     Within the past five-years, the Chemours Belle plant has not had accidental releases from RMP covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Chemours Belle Plant personnel are trained and equipped to respond to releases of the regulated substances.  The program is summarized as follows:

  *  Chemours Belle Plant personnel receive emergency response training.
  *  Chemours Belle Plant emergency responders are trained.
  *  Emergency response plans are in place for all plant tenants.
  *  All plant tenants participate in emergency drills.
  *  Critiques are held on drills and actual events.
  *  The Chemours Belle Plant emergency response team provides emergency response services to all tenants on the plant.
  *  The Chemours Belle Plant is a member of the local emergency planning committee.
  *  The Chemours Belle Plant Emergency Response Team trains local fire departments and agencies in response techniques and methodologies.

If a Major Release Occurs:

  *  Emergency alarm is sounded.
  *  Plant Emergency Operating Center is activated.
  *  Plant Incident Commander and emergency squad respond.
  *  Community emergency responders are notified and respond as appropriate.

                                                                                                                                                                                         GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

     The Chemours Belle Plant processes follow the requirements of Corporate Environmental, Health and Safety Standards, PSM-S21, Process Safety Management.  This standard includes and embraces the requirements of 29 CFR 1910.119 and 40 CFR Part 68.

The Chemours Belle Plant safety programs include:

Designing for Safety:
  *  A documented process technology system covering hazards of materials, equipment design basis, and process design basis.
  *  Extensive accident prevention and mitigation systems are strategically located.
  *  Applicable codes and standards are met or exceeded.
  *  Materials of construction are chosen to provide mechanical integrity.
  *  Quality Assurance ensures fabrication and installation in accordance with design specifications and proper assembly.

Maintaining our Plant:
  *  Maintenance personnel are trained and experienced.
  *  Contractors are trained and qualified.
  *  A work permit system controls hazards.

Operating Safely:
  *  Operators are trained and job qualified.
  *  Technical resources are available and utilized as required.
  *  Operators follow approved procedures.
